section.heading: Mandatory continuing education program for sworn members of the Metropolitan Police Department.

para.text: The Department shall implement a program of continuing education for its sworn members, which shall consist of a minimum of 32 hours of training each year.
The continuing education required by subsection (a) of this section shall include, at a minimum, instruction on:
Recognizing and preventing biased-based policing, racism, and white supremacy;
Limiting the use of force and employing de-escalation tactics;
Prohibited techniques, as that term is defined in § 5-125.02(6);
Best practices for identifying, and interacting with individuals living with, Alzheimer's Disease or other dementias, and the risks such individuals face, such as wandering and elder abuse[;]
The constitutional requirements for conducting searches and seizures, including the use of protective pat-downs, and the limitations on the use of consent searches, as described in § 23-526; and

The duty of a sworn officer to report, and the method for reporting, suspected misconduct or excessive use of force by a law enforcement officer that a sworn member observes or that comes to the sworn member's attention, as well as any governing District laws and regulations and Department written directives.
